intro: Centropogon magnus, commonly known as the giant centropogon, is a striking tropical plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, showy flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep orange. The plant thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and requires a humid climate to flourish. Its flowering period typically occurs during the rainy season, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
